Tools.name: White Hat Curated CTF Tools
Tools.description: a Github repo containing many commonly used tools for solving CTF challenges.

Tools.name: VMware Workstation/Fusion
Tools.description: a powerful virtualization hypervisor program that enables complete Operating System recreation within a virtual environment on a host machine (Download for free from OnTheHub!)

Tools.name: Kali Linux
Tools.description: a Debian-based Linux distro containing numerous tools and resources designed for digital forensics and penetration testing.

Tools.name: Metasploit Framework
Tools.description: a penetration testing framework written in Ruby and uses numerous modules to create basic and advanced payloads for vulnerability discovery and security awareness and defense.

Tools.name: CyberChef
Tools.description: a simple, modular, and intuitive web app for analyzing and decoding data easily and quickly.

Tools.name: Radare2
Tools.description: a complete framework for reverse-engineering and analyzing binaries, all designed to be ran from the command-line.

Tools.name: GDB
Tools.description: the GNU Project Debugger allows you to debug another program while it is running on a system.

Tools.name: ltrace
Tools.description: a Linux debugging utility that displays trace calls made by userspace applications/programs/binaries to shared libraries in order to facilitate reverse-engineering and debugging processes.

Tools.name: Burp Suite
Tools.description: a suite of networking tools, useful for capturing and modifying local network packets.

Tools.name: Netcat
Tools.description: a computer networking utility to read and write to network connections using TCP or UDP (a helpful cheat sheet from SANS can be found here!)

Tools.name: dd
Tools.description: a Linux command-line utility that can convert and copy files between different formats.

Tools.name: strings
Tools.description: a Linux command-line utility that prints the printable character sequences that are at least 4 characters long in a format that is easily modifiable and scriptable.

Tools.name: binwalk
Tools.description: a tool for searching through binary files for embedded files and executable code.

Tools.name: Xortool
Tools.description: a Python tool that performs xor analysis on a given file.

Useful Links.name: CTFtime
Useful Links.description: the official link to our CTF team! Click to view how we've been doing!

Useful Links.name: Slack
Useful Links.description: join our Slack to stay up-to-date on our CTF events and communications!

Useful Links.name: Cyber Threat Map
Useful Links.description: a real-time visualization of cyber attacks and malware threats as they are detected by Kaspersky Anti-Virus solutions.

Useful Links.name: ImmersiveLabs Cyber Academy
Useful Links.description: an online cybersecurity training platform that has a wide range of modules teaching penetration testing skills, reverse engineering skills, CTF-solving techniques, and more! (free access with your Cal Poly email!)

Useful Links.name: OverTheWire Wargames
Useful Links.description: a series of online CTF-training challenges designed to help you learn and practice security concept (if you haven't done CTFs before, try the Bandit challenges!)

Useful Links.name: VulnHub
Useful Links.description: a system of challenges stored within virtual machines that allow anyone to gain practical 'hands-on' experience in digital security, computer software & network administration.

Cool Security Books.name: Practical Malware Analysis (PMA)
Cool Security Books.description: the industry-standard on teaching basic and advanced malware analysis tools and techniques! Highly recommended if you want to learn how to safely analyze malware, reverse engineer, debug, and disassemble malicious software, and more! (applies to Windows-based malware and virus samples)
